de.embl.rieslab.emu.ui.uiproperties

Class UIProperty

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.embl.rieslab.emu.ui.uiproperties.UIProperty
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    MultiStateUIProperty, RescaledUIProperty, SingleStateUIProperty, TwoStateUIProperty

    public class UIProperty
extends java.lang.Object
    A UIProperty acts as a link between a JComponent and a Micro-Manager device property ( MMProperty). It should be instantiated in the initializeProperties() method of a ConfigurablePanel and added with the addUIProperty(). The UIProperty will appear in the configuration wizard of EMU. The user can then assign a Micro-Manager device property to the UIProperty. While several UIProperties can be allocated to a single MMProperty, each UIPropoerty can only be assigned to a single MMproperty.

    A user interaction with a JComponent should trigger a corresponding UIProperty. The ConfigurablePanel calls setPropertyValue(String). In turns, this will change the value of the MMProperty. All other UIProperty allocated to the MMProperty will be updated. Finally, updated UIProperty will call the owner ConfigurablePanel (triggerPropertyHasChanged()) to change the relevant JComponents.

    UIProperties can be labeled with a PropertyFlag to allow categorizing them. This mechanism is not used within EMU, but can be exploited in the plugins.

    Author:
    Joran Deschamps
    See Also:
    SingleStateUIProperty, TwoStateUIProperty, MultiStateUIProperty, RescaledUIProperty

      • getPropertyLabel

        public java.lang.String getPropertyLabel()
        Returns the UIProperty's label
        Returns:

      • getDescription

        public java.lang.String getDescription()
        Returns the UIProperty's description, this description is used in the Help window of the configuration wizard.
        Returns:
        Description of the UIProperty

      • assignProperty

        public boolean assignProperty(MMProperty prop)
                       throws AlreadyAssignedUIPropertyException,
                              IncompatibleMMProperty
        Assigns the UIProperty to a MMProperty. A UIProperty can only be assigned once and to a single MMProperty. This method will throw an AlreadyAssignedUIPropertyException if there is an attempt to assign it to a second MMProperty.
        Parameters:
        prop - MMproperty to assign the UIProperty to.
        Returns:
        True if the property was allocated successfully, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        AlreadyAssignedUIPropertyException - Exception thrown when the UIProperty has already been assigned
        IncompatibleMMProperty - exception thrown when the MMProperty is not compatible with the UIProperty.

      • isCompatibleMMProperty

        public boolean isCompatibleMMProperty(MMProperty prop)
        Checks if the MMProperty is compatible with the UIProperty.
        Parameters:
        prop - MMProperty
        Returns:
        True if it is, false otherwise.

      • isAssigned

        public boolean isAssigned()
        Checks if the UIProperty has been assigned or not.
        Returns:
        True if the UIProperty is assigned to a MMProperty, false otherwise.

      • mmPropertyHasChanged

        public void mmPropertyHasChanged(java.lang.String value)
        Notifies its ConfigurablePanel owner that the MMProperty it is assigned to has changed its value.
        Parameters:
        value - New value of the MMProperty

      • getPropertyValue

        public java.lang.String getPropertyValue()
        Returns the value of the MMProperty it is assigned to.
        Returns:
        Value of the MMProperty or an empty String if the UIProperty has not been assigned to a MMProperty

        Sets the value of the assigned MMProperty to newValue.
        Parameters:
        newValue - New value
        Returns:
        True if the value was set, false otherwise.

      • isMMPropertyReadOnly

        public boolean isMMPropertyReadOnly()
        Checks if the MMProperty assigned to this UIProperty is read-only.
        Returns:
        True if the MMProperty is read-only, false otherwise. If the UIProperty is not assigned, returns true.

      • hasMMPropertyAllowedValues

        public boolean hasMMPropertyAllowedValues()
        Checks if the MMProperty assigned to this UIProperty has allowed values.
        Returns:
        True if it does, false otherwise. If the UIProperty is not assigned, then returns false.

      • hasMMPropertyLimits

        public boolean hasMMPropertyLimits()
        Checks if the MMProperty assigned to this UIProperty has limits.
        Returns:
        True if it does, false otherwise. If the UIProperty is not assigned, then returns false.

      • getAllowedValues

        public java.lang.String[] getAllowedValues()
        Returns the allowed values of the assigned MMProperty.
        Returns:
        Allowed values or null if the MMProperty does not have any or if the UIProperty is not assigned.

      • getLimits

        public java.lang.String[] getLimits()
        Returns the limits of the assigned MMProperty.
        Returns:
        Limits or null if the MMProperty does not have any or if the UIProperty is not assigned.

        public PropertyFlag getFlag()
        Returns the PropertyFlag of this UIProperty.
        Returns:
        PropertyFlag of the UIProperty

      • isValueAllowed

        public boolean isValueAllowed(java.lang.String val)
        Checks if the String val is an allowed value for the MMProperty.
        Parameters:
        val - Value to test
        Returns:
        True if the value is allowed, false otherwise. If the UIProperty is not assigned, returns true

      • isConfigGroupMMProperty

        public boolean isConfigGroupMMProperty()
        Checks if the assigned MMProperty is a Configuration group from Micro-manager.
        Returns:
        True if it is, false otherwise or if the UIProperty is not assigned.
